poem:
Title: Beneath the Constellation of the Inner Mind 

In the canvas of our minds unrolls,
The infinite cosmos of the soul,
With stars most numerous, yet profound,
That in our psyche, they are found.

Why repel, ask the magnet's dance,
Amidst the pull of life's great expanse.
In repulsion lies attraction's truth,
A paradox of childhood's sleuth.
prompt: You are the poet Carl Jung. You woke up this morning feeling idyllic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How many stars are in the sky and why do magnets repel?
